content.description: This is the line of bolts underneath the massive roof featuring two lines that split at a freehanging midway anchor below a steep roof feature containing hard steep boulder problems. Climb soft rock through sustained weird moves to a kneebar rest before a distinct crux leads to a no hands pedestal and a tough anchor clip.
content.location: Climb to the midway anchor in the massive roof on the left side of ENT Gully.

content.description: The bolt line just to the right of Quickbeam which trends shares the top few bolts of climbing with Quickbeam.This route starts to the right of the bolt on big incut jugs. Big moves on slightly smaller holds than its left neighbor, but it feels similar in difficulty.A 12c variation starts directly under the bolt line climbs pockets into the regular route, and then mantles directly after the flake instead of traversing into the arete.
Right of the ground climb a steep arete into steep jugs with big moves. Ends with some hero moves to an anchor to the right of the massive roof.
content.location: This is currently the furthest route up ENT Gully.

climbs.name: Quickbeam
climbs.fa: Travis Peckham, Paul Hansen, Alden Pellet

content.description:
One of the single best sport climbs in the state. Steep and unrelenting. If 11+ is your game, this route is a must do. With a 4-minute approach and a lower-off anchor, it doesn't get more accessible than this.

 Begin at the very bottom of the arete and make move after move of steep exposed climbing.
content.location: The arete. Yeah, that big one.

content.description: This route and Judy's Ridge, the bolt line on the arete to the right, make a good pair of easier routes. The bolts aren't quite spaced like in Bolton, but it is a casual way to enjoy some quality Smuggs schist in a unique locale.An initial crack leads to a clean face with a few bolts and a lower off anchor.
content.protection: A handful of bolts. A cam may be nice for the first few moves.
content.location: The low angle slab opposite the massive overhanging face of Quickbeam, etc., at the mouth of the ENT Gully. This is on the left side of the obvious clean rock.

content.description: The first bolt line left of Quickbeam characterized by slab climbing and weird roof mantles. Better than it looks.
A short but sustained line to the right of treebeard.  A bouldery crux leads to sustained pumpy flat edges.

The 2 walls that make up ENT gully (a well traveled ice climbing area) have a number of sport climbs with bolted anchors. The left (south) side is steep/overhung w/ higher grade sport routes. The right (north) side is a moderate slab w/ a few nice easier sport climbs.
